item.title: PostgresSQL Notes
item.description: Table of Content Introduction to PostgreSQL ðŸš§ Installation Install PostgreSQL in Ubuntu Install PostgreSQL in CentOS Method 1: PostgreSQL Yum Repository Method 2: Using DNF Initial Configuration Creating a New PostgreSQL Database Cluster Understanding PostgreSQL Roles and Databases Creating a New Postgres Role Some Very First Commands Examples CREATE DATABASE DROP DATABASE CREATE TABLE Table Definition INSERT INTO SELECT DROP TABLE The Surface Sea Mockaroo Data Generator ORDER BY ASC DESC ORDER BY with Two-parameter DISTINCT WHERE BETWEEN LIKE GROUP BY GROUP BY with ORDER BY GROUP BY HAVING COALESCE Another Table Called car Basic Functions MAX MIN AVG ROUND COUNT SUM Basic Arithmetic Operations Discount Calculation ALIAS NULLIF DATE NOW Addition and Subtraction of Date INTERVAL EXTRACT AGE The Shallow Sea PRIMARY KEY CONSTRAINTS UNIQUE constraint CHECK Constraint DELETE UPDATE ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING DO UPDATE SET Foreign Keys, Joins and Relationships Delete Record with Foreign Keys JOIN INNER JOIN LEFT JOIN RIGHT JOIN FULL OUTER JOIN Exporting Query Results to CSV Serials and Sequences Extensions UUID Datatype UUID as Primary Key Introduction to PostgreSQL PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system with over 30 years of active development that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability, feature robustness, and performance.
